body.p:
Lebanon Feb 27.65
Hon Thomas E. Bramlette.
Dear Sir.
Believing as I do that you have deeply at heart the interest peace and welfare of our State, I am prompted to lay before you as as possible a Statement as follows: --

You are doubtless aware of the difficulty pending between The Akins of Lincoln & the Rowseys of Boyle -- As I understand, the Akin party applied for and obtained a commission to recruit a company for the State Service -- which was probably well enough --
Shortly afterwards -- the other party (Rowseys) Applied for a commission and was promptly refused, -- which was we think also well enough --
Rowseys failing to obtain a commision in their own Name -- Sent forward to you an Uncle from I think Adair County -- One Capt Curry, formerly of the 13. Ky

If I am correctly informed -- both parties are now organizing rapidly and unless your Excelency can do some thing for the people of the immediate country in which they live -- fears are entertained that it will grow into something awful indeed --
Rest assured there is even now a reign of terror among those people who so well know the material of which the parties are composed -- and especially the Rowseys --
Wishing that you may be enabled to spare some little time to a careful investigation of this matter -- And act in the case as your good judgment may dictate

I am Sir
Your Obedient Servt --
"Peace"

Lebanon Ky
Feby. 27" 1865
"Peace" --
To the Gov.
Asks that a stop be put to the depredating of the Akins of Lincoln & the Rowseys of Boyle Cos.
an officer will be sent to look after their operations
Recd A. G. O. Ky 1 Mar 1865
